p: The samples with uniform thickness and no insect eye and mildew were selected, defoliated and cut off. The samples of fresh stem of D. officinale were dried in an oven at 50 Â°C for 15 days. The dried stems were ground to powder. One hundred g of powder from each group was placed in a round bottom flask with 500 mL of n-hexane (analytical purity) and stirred evenly. After extracting twice by the condensation reflux method, the liquid supernatant was obtained by decompression filtration. The n-hexane was removed by rotary evaporation and the paste can be used as a backup. Each extraction was repeated three times.
